meanings.definition: Of or relating to chaff or husks.
meanings.sent1: The farmer used a paleal sieve to separate the wheat from the chaff.
meanings.sent2: The paleal covering of the corn protected it from pests.
meanings.sent3: The paleal scarecrow in the field looked like a ghost in the moonlight.
meanings.sent4: Her paleal dress rustled in the wind like dry leaves.
meanings.sent5: The paleal texture of the rice husk felt rough and dry to the touch.

meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of chaff or husks.
meanings.sent1: The old book had a paleal smell, like dried leaves.
meanings.sent2: The paleal color of the grasshopper helped it blend into the dry grass.
meanings.sent3: The paleal pattern on the fabric reminded her of autumn leaves.
meanings.sent4: His paleal voice was soft and whispery, like the rustling of dry leaves.
meanings.sent5: The paleal appearance of the old barn gave it a weathered and rustic charm.
